Title.evidence: A Cluster Randomised Controlled Trial of the Modified Hospital Elder Life Program in Reducing Delirium and Length of Stay in Older Patients Undergoing Abdominal Surgery

Participants.evidence: older patients (≥65 years) scheduled for elective gastrectomy, pancreaticoduodenectomy, or colectomy with an expected LOS longer than 6 days

Intervention.evidence: receive either the modified Hospital Elder Life Program (mHELP) or usual care

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the presence of delirium, assessed daily using the Confusion Assessment Method

Number_Randomised.evidence: 377 were randomised (197 to mHELP, 180 to control)

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: Delirium occurred in 6.6% of mHELP participants compared to 15.1% of controls, with a relative risk of 0.44 (95% CI, 0.23–0.83; P = .008)
